image.altText: Photo taken from the back seat of a car, showing a man in a cowboy hat driving a dirt road along the border wall.

props.synopsis: Where Trump's unfinished wall ends on Jim's ranch you can simply walk across the border into Mexico. It's the centre of a political battle that will shape the US presidential election.

title.children: 'The cartel scouts are watching us': Travelling a dangerous road to Trump's unfinished border wall

image.altText: Donald Trump raises his fist while surrounded by secret service agents.

props.synopsis: Television is regularly declared to be dead, or at least dying. But nobody seems to have told American politics, where TV still wields a bafflingly disproportionate degree of power in what is supposed to be the greatest democracy on Earth.

title.children: We've reached a point where Hollywood actors are telling hard truths America's leaders would rather avoid

image.altText: A woman holds a framed photo of another woman.

props.synopsis: Chrystalle had a history of self-harm and was diagnosed with Borderline Personality Disorder. One day, she presented to the local hospital, she was left alone for too long.

title.children: Chrystalle pleaded with her local hospital to keep her alive. She was offered tea and left alone to die

image.altText: A woman stands in front of a tree

props.synopsis: Police are investigating potential links between four robberies in which some residents were allegedly threatened in their homes with weapons.

title.children: Alice Springs resident says she was threatened with machete after running to help neighbour

image.altText: A woman wearing navy blue jacket rests her chin on her hand

props.synopsis: Kimberly Cheatle has resigned from her position after admitting that the attempted assassination amounted to a failure of her mission to protect America's leaders.

title.children: US Secret Service director resigns after conceding agency failed to prevent assassination attempt on Donald Trump

image.altText: A woman and man standing side by side with the US Capitol building in background, holding a poster saying KIDNAPPED

props.synopsis: As Benjamin Netanyahu arrives in Washington DC to meet with Joe Biden and address the US Congress, families of those kidnapped on October 7 are frustrated that the Israeli leader is wasting time, delaying a hostage deal to bring their loved ones home.

title.children: These American Israeli families lost loved ones on October 7. They say Netanyahu's US trip is a waste of time

image.altText: A young person playing in snow at Guyra in NSW.

props.synopsis: A cold spell across Australia's south-eastern states has led to record demand in the national electricity market (NEM) across late autumn and early winter.

title.children: Wintry weather drives electricity prices to record levels

image.altText: A silhoutted person looks at a ship and a helicopter out on the water.

props.synopsis: Months after declining a United States request to deploy a warship to the Middle East, the Royal Australian Navy is preparing to assume command of an international maritime task force dedicated to protecting shipping lanes around the Red Sea.

title.children: Australia to take command of Red Sea task force as trade route threats in Middle East persist

image.altText: A composite picture of LeBron James, Katie Ledecky and Noah Lyles

props.synopsis: There are more than 10,000 of the world's best athletes competing at the Paris Olympics. Here's a very short list of who you should keep your eyes on when the action gets underway.

title.children: The biggest names and brightest stars to watch at the Paris Olympics

image.altText: A large centrelink sign with two men walking past in the background

props.synopsis: More than 11 million calls to Centrelink and Medicare were unanswered in the year to April, while wait times increased to almost an hour for some categories of support.

title.children: Long Centrelink wait times as 11 million calls go unanswered

image.altText: Police officers patrol in front of the Eiffel Tower.

props.synopsis: French police investigate claims a 25-year-old Australian woman was raped by five men in Paris, days before the city is set to host the Olympic Games.

title.children: Police investigate alleged gang rape of Australian woman in Paris

image.altText: A woman stands next to a man who is holding a child. The woman and man are smiling.

props.synopsis: Liam and Nicole want their children to have the education they didn't. How focusing on the early years impacts a child's future trajectory.

title.children: Five kids, two bedrooms: Inside the battle for a better childhood education

image.altText: Beau Lamarre in a police uniform

props.synopsis: NSW Police have laid new charges against former Constable and accused double murderer Beau Lamarre-Condon. Mr Lamarre-Condon was charged with the murders of Sydney couple Jesse Baird and Luke Davies in February.

title.children: Fresh charges laid against alleged double murderer Beau Lamarre-Condon

image.altText: A middle aged white man with grey hair and a leather hat standing in front of a large tree marked with a large yellow H

props.synopsis: A New South Wales government agency has now racked up more than $1.1 million in penalties for more than a dozen instances of unlawful activity in less than five years, including seven criminal convictions.

title.children: 'The animals have been killed': Government agency racks up convictions and fines for illegal logging

image.altText: Justine Davis wearing a political campaign t-shirt out the front of a busy market stall.

props.synopsis: Independents are aiming to capitalise on voter dissatisfaction with the two major parties at next month's Northern Territory election, with candidates contesting seats across the entire

title.children: After 2022's Teal wave, independents set to challenge both NT major parties

image.altText: MONA Ladie's Lounge and Kirsha Kaechele and supporters.

props.synopsis: Fresh off its faked 'Picassos' controversy, Tasmania's Mona reveals it will argue about the "supremacy of men" in a Supreme Court bid to re-open its women-only art installation, the Ladies Lounge.

title.children: 'Supremacy of men' to be argued in court at Mona's appeal against discrimination ruling

image.altText: A teenage girl looks at a bikini model on Instagram on her phone.

props.synopsis: Even though social media is free to use, research found many university students would pay to quit it — especially TikTok — if they could beat their fear of missing out.

title.children: Would you pay to quit TikTok and Instagram? You'd be surprised how many would

image.altText: A pink sky with a line of small satellite lights in a row

props.synopsis: The solar storm in May did more than just produce exceptional auroras. An analysis of US Space Force data has found more than 5,000 satellites had to alter their position to avoid deorbiting or crashing into each other.

title.children: Thousands of Starlink satellites 'manoeuvred en masse' during recent solar storms, risking collision

image.altText: Bacchus Marsh principal Andrew Neal standing outside the school.

props.synopsis: The principal of a regional Victorian school left reeling from a deepfake nude-sharing photo incident has called for urgent federal government action to protect other children.

title.children: 'Now is the time': Principal calls for government to clamp down on explicit deepfake image sharing on social media

image.altText: Matildas

props.synopsis: Two former world champions and a rising African powerhouse stand in the Matildas' way. So how will the Olympic group stage define their medal chances?

title.children: How the Matildas tackle their Olympic group will prove their medal credentials

image.altText: Davis Clayton in high vis jacket and helmet riding a motorbike through a Melbourne street

props.synopsis: There's a widening gap in the working rights of gig workers and white-collar professionals, which the federal government is hoping it can plug with new laws set to kick in soon.

title.children: Gap in work conditions between gig workers and white-collar professions widens

image.altText: Four protesters stand in a line in a street with a large crowd and smoke haze behind them.

props.synopsis: Students at universities and colleges in Bangladesh say they were "brutally attacked" in clashes with the authorities while innocent bystanders were being killed on their way to buy groceries.

title.children: Bangladeshi student protesters recount 'brutal' violence amid government crackdown

image.altText: A young girl kisses a young boy on the cheek.

props.synopsis: The Refugee Council of Australia says families are waiting far too long to be reunited with their close relatives, even after being granted permanent residency.

title.children: Saslesh and Eunice have each other, but they've been separated from their family in Australia for 12 years

image.altText: A man with dark hair and a moustache stands at a dinner table holding a piece of paper and addresses the seated group

props.synopsis: A bucks party in the bush serves as the setting for Birdeater, a debut psychological thriller that re-evaluates contemporary masculinity.

title.children: A bucks party in the bush is the sordid setting for this gen Z take on Wake in Fright

image.altText: The Australian passport in front of a night-mode world map

props.synopsis: The Henley Passport Index 2024 has again crowned Singapore the country with the world's most powerful passport. See where Australia sits on the list.

title.children: These are the world's most powerful passports in 2024. See where Australia sits

image.altText: An epaulette shark curled up amongst coral.

props.synopsis: These sharks may not have an open jaw and razor sharp teeth, but researchers say they are the "toughest" on the Great Barrier Reef with the ability to survive in water that is extremely low in oxygen.

title.children: Researchers say these sharks with a 'sassy walk' could tell us more about the effects of climate change

image.altText: Candice Prosser sits on a pink chair wearing a pink top underneath a dark suit against a black background

props.synopsis: Being a woman of six-feet tall is, statistically speaking, extremely rare. ABC reporter Candice Prosser reflects on falling in the upper 99th percentile for height for an Australian woman and speaks to others using their stature to their advantage.

title.children: Height advantage: The tall women who are embracing their stature

image.altText: A group of Australian female hockey players celebrate a goal against Japan at the Tokyo Olympics.

props.synopsis: More than half of Australia's Olympic team is made up of women, but just 9 per cent of elite coaches are female.

title.children: Shortage of female coaches at Olympic level highlighted as 'critical issue'

image.altText: A Windows PC shwing a "Blue Screen of Death" error.

props.synopsis: For much of the world, the CrowdStrike outage meant grounded flights and closed supermarkets. But many parts of Asia did not have the same society-wide consequences of the software update gone wrong.

title.children: China got through the CrowdStrike meltdown virtually unscathed. Here's why

image.altText: A composite of Kamala Harris and Donald Trump.

props.synopsis: Kamala Harris's campaign says she has secured the support of enough Democratic delegates to become her party's nominee. So how could her campaign against Donald Trump shape up?

title.children: Trump is pouncing on Harris's perceived weaknesses. Here's how her campaign could turn them into strengths

image.altText: Young person using laptop computer in home setting.

props.synopsis: While the jobless rate has been slowly creeping higher, alarm bells are ringing about the potential for a big surge in unemployment as recruiters report seeing hundreds of applications for a single job.

title.children: ANZ warns unemployment could rise above 5pc as 'over-qualified' job applicants feel 'abandoned by society'

image.altText: AWE Casino platform in Victoria's Otway Basin

props.synopsis: The federal government opens waters off the Victorian, Tasmanian and South Australian coasts for new gas exploration as it seeks to increase Australia's supply.

title.children: Waters off SA, Victoria and Tasmania opened for new gas exploration

image.altText: Sam Kerr grabs her head after the Matildas' World Cp loss to Sweden.

props.synopsis: The Matildas have finished fourth in the last Olympics and the last football World Cup. Caitlin Foord believes it has the team primed for a tilt at Parisian Olympic glory.

title.children: The Matildas are haunted by heartbreak. Caitlin Foord says it has them primed for the Olympics

image.altText: Peter Dutton ai dance video TikTok

props.synopsis: Just hours after the Queensland premier described a fake video of him dancing as a "turning point" for democracy, a video surfaced of his federal colleagues using the same tactics.

title.children: Labor used AI video to mock Dutton's nuclear plan

image.altText: A young woman in a multicoloured jumper looks off camera

props.synopsis: The detective who led the investigation into the 19-year-old's disappearance has told a murder trial the operation was hampered by various factors including listening devices in the accused killer's home and car being installed incorrectly.

title.children: 'Distorted' audio from incorrectly installed bugs hampered Amber Haigh investigation, murder trial hears
